data.title: Overrun by wild git processes
data.body:
- Open a large git repo in vscode (here, chromium)
- Quickly after opening vscode, make an edit, save the file
  - Repeat making an edit and saving several times

Git processes are spawned without limit:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/24571668/9d0844b8-1627-11e7-9036-78975ba19788.png)

`.gitignore` is the file I was editing. I think another one is spawned each time I save the file. My computer is slow and my tunes start skipping (my main motivation for investigating).

They run for a very long time. I close that vscode window, and they are still running a minute or more later.

Only reproes if I do this right after opening the vscode window. I can't repro it later.

data.title: No way to open a file that's excluded in search.exclude
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.10.2 (1.10.2)
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a folder to your `"search.exclude"` setting, such as
    
       "search.exclude": {
           "**/vendor": true,

2. Press `ctrl+p` and paste in an exact file path that's in the ignored folder, like `vendor/something.java`

**Expected result:**

The file to show up, and be opened by hitting enter.

**Actual result:**

"No results found", and there is no way to open the file.

I would expect "search.exclude" to prevent files from showing up when searching, which it does. I was surprised to find out I can't open it through the normal file finder, though.

data.title: DnD text: make the right mouse button press cancel the dragging
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Win10x64

Right now after dragging a text sample every mouse button confirms the operation (both move and copy text). Normally, in most editors the right mouse button cancels the dragging, while others (the middle one f.e.) just doesn't do anything. Please make the dragging conformation exclusive to the left mouse button and canceling - to the right one.

Thank you.

data.title: DnD text: make copy cursor change on keypress
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Please make the copy cursor (the one with the plus sign) change on keypress, not only on the mouse move

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Win10x64

Steps to Reproduce:
![](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=0B-OJBofmehO3MlA1aW1KdGktTlU)
1. Start dragging
2. Stop the mouse
3. press CTRL then release and repeat - the cursor won't react to
5. Do the same while moving the mouse - the cursor is changed on position change accordingly to the current CTRL key state.

data.title: files.trimTrailingWhitespace: Trim all kinds of whitespace
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-Insider
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Turn on `"files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true` in `settings.json`.
2. Paste character code 160 into a file. (You can get this with ```node -p '`<${String.fromCharCode(160)}>`'```)
3. Save.
4. It should be trimmed, but isn't.

data.title: Insiders can't find existing preLaunchTask
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider (2017-03-31)
- OS Version: Win10

I use a gulpfile.js to do my command line builds and I reference these tasks when debugging my extension (and tests) in VS Code via launch.json.  Insiders 2017-03-15 successfully finds my 'publishbuild' preLaunchTask and allows me to debug my extension.  However, 03-31 displays the error:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2796865/24561686/ad46c5d2-1615-11e7-9f88-4fa1c7b5a1c2.png)

There are a couple of other tasks in my gulpfile that will cause the same error.  Others will work and allow me to work around the issue (e.g., publishall).

My gulpfile: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Microsoft/vsts-vscode/master/gulpfile.js
My launch.json: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Microsoft/vsts-vscode/master/.vscode/launch.json

Steps to Reproduce:
-  Unknown except to clone my repo, npm install, open the repo root folder and F5.

data.title: Feature/keybindings adds
New Feature Request: Add menu item "Open Recent in New Window"
data.body:
Please add parallel menu along with `Open Recent >` like `Open Recent New Window >` that opens the selected item in new window. 

This is very useful as we deal with multiple projects and each time we need to manually open the new window and then do open recent. If we forget to do it, all commands running in the terminal gets terminated and we need to start over again.

data.title: Debugger does not break on symlinked module (NodeJS/Mac OSX Sierra)
data.body:
I think there's an issue with symlinks on Mac. I used npm link to link a module. The code runs fine, but adding a breakpoint does not break. 

- VSCode Version: February 2017 (version 1.10)
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra Version 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a child NodeJS module - just hello world will do. - run npm link in the module directory.
2.Create a parent module and npm link the child. `npm link child` from the parent directory.
3. Write a script to call the child code from the parent project. `child.sayHello()`
4. navigate to node_modules and add a breakpoint in the child code.
5. Run the debug for NodeJS.
6. It probably won't break on the child.
7. npm unlink child
8. Change package.json to import by adding the child as a file dependency. `child: '../child'`
9. npm install to 'copy' the files in rather than symlink them.
10. reset the breakpoint in the child code.
11. Rerun the debugger - it should now break in the child code.

data.title: Task dialog switches to output view
data.body:
- create a task in task.json
```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "yeoman",
            "command": "yo"
        } 
    ],
    "_runner": "terminal" 
}
```
- run the task
- while the task is running, run a second task
- dialog asks:
There is an active running task right now. Terminate it first before executing another task.

The output view is made visible for no clear reason.

data.title: Markdown Preview Unable to handle GFM task list
data.body:
If i insert a GFM like Todo Tasklist like this: ``` Todo List ====== - [ ] Task 1 - [ ] Task 2 - [x] Task 3 - [ ] Task 4 ``` it gets parsed to : ```

TODO List

  • [ ] Task 1
  • [ ] Task 2
  • [ x] Task 3
  • [ ] Task 4
``` instead of as it should be (in my Opinion, and also shown here https://github.com/blog/1375-task-lists-in-gfm-issues-pulls-comments ): ```

TODO List

``` is this really not done correctly or am i missing a setting or something like that?

data.title: SCM viewlet: Cmd-Click-based multi select doesn't work

- OS Version: macOS

This works fine in stable.
